Slide 16: The Role of the Complement System in Myasthenia Gravis

* Explanation of the complement system:
	+ The complement system is a group of proteins in the blood that help the body fight infections.
	+ When activated, the complement system can cause inflammation and attack the body's own cells and tissues.
* Explanation of the role of the complement system in myasthenia gravis:
	+ In myasthenia gravis, the complement system mistakenly attacks the nerve receptors at the junction between the nerve and muscle.
	+ This leads to muscle weakness, the hallmark symptom of myasthenia gravis.
	+ By targeting the complement system, complement therapy aims to reduce the attack on the nerve receptors and improve muscle strength in patients with the condition.
